title: movie
text: package provides two datasets: summer_movies summer_movie_genres.
code: # Loading datasets data("summer_movies") data("summer_movie_genres")  # Viewing the first few rows of each dataset head(summer_movies) #>      tconst title_type                   primary_title #> 1 tt0011462      movie               Midsummer Madness #> 2 tt0026714      movie       A Midsummer Night's Dream #> 3 tt0033864      movie The Teachers on Summer Vacation #> 4 tt0037325      movie                    Summer Storm #> 5 tt0038406      movie               Centennial Summer #> 6 tt0038738    tvMovie       A Midsummer Night's Dream #>              original_title year runtime_minutes                 genres #> 1         Midsummer Madness 1920              60                  Drama #> 2 A Midsummer Night's Dream 1935             133 Comedy,Fantasy,Romance #> 3  Magistrarna på sommarlov 1941              86                 Comedy #> 4              Summer Storm 1944             106  Crime,Drama,Film-Noir #> 5         Centennial Summer 1946             102  History,Music,Romance #> 6 A Midsummer Night's Dream 1946             150          Drama,Fantasy #>                      simple_title average_rating num_votes #> 1               midsummer madness            7.4        19 #> 2        a midsummer nights dream            6.8      3931 #> 3 the teachers on summer vacation            5.5        78 #> 4                    summer storm            6.6       688 #> 5               centennial summer            6.1       431 #> 6        a midsummer nights dream            7.5        10 head(summer_movie_genres) #>      tconst  genres #> 1 tt0011462   Drama #> 2 tt0026714  Comedy #> 3 tt0026714 Fantasy #> 4 tt0026714 Romance #> 5 tt0033864  Comedy #> 6 tt0037325   Crime

title: movie
text: summer_movies: dataset contains detailed information summer-themed movies, including movie titles, release year, runtime, genres, IMDb rating, number votes. summer_movie_genres: dataset includes genre information associated movie.

title: movie
text: Let’s plot average IMDb ratings Comedy movies time analyze trends.
code: library(ggplot2) library(dplyr) #>  #> Attaching package: 'dplyr' #> The following objects are masked from 'package:stats': #>  #>     filter, lag #> The following objects are masked from 'package:base': #>  #>     intersect, setdiff, setequal, union  # Filter data for Comedy movies comedy_movies <- summer_movies %>% filter(genres=="comedy") # Plot average rating over time ggplot(comedy_movies, aes(x = year, y = average_rating)) +   geom_line(color = "blue") +   geom_point() +   labs(title = "Average Ratings of Comedy Movies Over Time",        x = "Year", y = "Average Rating")

what: Distribution of Ratings for a Selected Genre
title: movie
text: can also explore distribution IMDb ratings specific genre. ’s visualize distribution ratings Comedy movies:
code: ggplot(comedy_movies, aes(x = average_rating)) +   geom_histogram(binwidth = 0.5, fill = "skyblue", color = "black") +   labs(title = "Distribution of Ratings for Comedy Movies",        x = "Average Rating", y = "Frequency")

title: movie
text: genre’s popularity, can examine number votes movie received time.
code: ggplot(comedy_movies, aes(x = year, y = num_votes)) +   geom_line(color = "purple") +   geom_point() +   labs(title = "Popularity of Comedy Movies Over Time (Number of Votes)",        x = "Year", y = "Number of Votes")

what: Using the Shiny App for Interactive Exploration
title: movie
text: movie package includes interactive Shiny app, provides user-friendly interface filter movies genre, year range, rating.

title: movie
text: Explore Summer-Themed Movies app two main sections: Sidebar Panel: apply filters customize data displayed graphs. Main Panel: section displays graphs based filters selected Sidebar Panel.

previous_headings: App Layout > Step-by-Step Guide to Using the App
title: movie
text: Sidebar Panel provides filtering options narrow movie data genre, year range, minimum rating. Genre Dropdown: Select specific genre (e.g., Comedy, Drama) choose “” include movies genres. Use: Select genre dropdown view movies within genre. Choosing “” shows movies every genre. Year Range Slider: Filter movies release year. slider defaults entire range years dataset. Use: Adjust slider set start end years. example, setting 1990 2020 show movies released period. Minimum Rating Slider: Set minimum IMDb rating filter higher-rated movies. Use: Move slider set rating threshold. instance, minimum rating 7 display movies rated 7 . Download Button: Save filtered dataset computer CSV file.

previous_headings: App Layout > Step-by-Step Guide to Using the App
title: movie
text: Main Panel displays two visualizations based selected filters: Distribution Average Ratings: histogram shows distribution IMDb ratings movies matching selected filters. Higher bars indicate movies particular rating range. Average Rating Time: line plot shows trend average IMDb ratings time selected genre filters. helps observe rating trends changes years.

title: movie
text: explore popular Comedy movies 2000 onwards high ratings: Select Genre: Choose “Comedy”. Year Range: Set slider start 2000. Minimum Rating: Set rating slider 7. Download Data: Click “Download Filtered Data” save subset. graphs update show highly rated Comedy movies 2000 onwards.

title: movie
text: movie package provides powerful tools exploring analyzing summer-themed movies. can filter data genre, visualize trends time, use Shiny app interactive exploration. package ideal discovering insights summer-themed movies understanding different genres evolved years. details, refer function documentation Shiny app exploration.

what: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
title: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
text: movie package provides tools exploring analyzing summer-themed movies using IMDb data. package includes Shiny app interactive data exploration, functions filtering analyzing movie data, visualizations insights rating trends genre distributions. package designed help users discover trends, patterns, statistics related summer-themed movies. can view comprehensive guide package website.

title: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
text: can install movie package directly GitHub. First, ensure devtools package installed, use install_github(): can install development version movie GitHub :
code: # Install devtools if you haven't already install.packages("devtools")  # Install the movie package from GitHub devtools::install_github("ETC5523-2024/assignment-4-packages-and-shiny-apps-neharika999/movie")

title: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
text: filter_movies_by_genre() function filters movies genre. see comedy movies:
code: # Filtering for comedy movies filtered_data <- summer_movies %>% filter(genres=="Drama") head(filtered_data)

what: Example: Plotting Average Ratings Over Time
title: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
text: Use ggplot2 visualize trends filtered data. ’s example plotting average ratings time specific genre:
code: library(ggplot2)  # Average rating plot for comedy movies over time ggplot(filtered_data, aes(x = year, y = average_rating)) +   geom_line(color = "blue") +   geom_point() +   labs(title = "Average Ratings of Comedy Movies Over Time",        x = "Year", y = "Average Rating")

title: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
text: package includes interactive Shiny app allows users explore data web interface. can launch app using following command: Shiny app provides easy way : Select specific genres filter rating year range. View interactive plots gain insights summer-themed movies.
code: launch_app()

title: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
text: package includes vignette demonstrates use features. Load vignette follows:
code: vignette("movie_analysis")

title: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
text: encounter issues like contribute development movie package, feel free create pull request submit issue GitHub.

title: Launch the Shiny Application — launch_app
text: function launches Shiny application exploring summer-themed movies. app provides interactive filtering options genre, year range, minimum rating, along visualizations analyze trends distributions movie data.

title: Launch the Shiny Application — launch_app
code: launch_app()

title: Launch the Shiny Application — launch_app
text: Launches Shiny application interactive data exploration.

what: movie: A Package for Analyzing and Exploring Summer-Themed Movies — movie
title: movie: A Package for Analyzing and Exploring Summer-Themed Movies — movie
text: movie package provides tools exploring analyzing summer-themed movies using IMDb data. package includes Shiny app interactive data exploration, functions filtering analyzing movie data, visualizations insights rating trends genre distributions. package designed help users discover trends, patterns, statistics related summer-themed movies.

title: movie: A Package for Analyzing and Exploring Summer-Themed Movies — movie
text: Data Filtering: Use functions like filter_movies_by_genre() filter movie dataset genre, year range, IMDb rating. Trend Analysis: Visualize trends IMDb ratings popularity movies time. Interactive Shiny App: Explore data interactively filtering options genre, year range, rating. Documentation Examples: Access detailed documentation, usage examples, vignette guide using package.

title: movie: A Package for Analyzing and Exploring Summer-Themed Movies — movie
text: can install movie package directly GitHub:
code: # Install devtools if not installed install.packages("devtools")  # Install the movie package from GitHub devtools::install_github("ETC5523-2024/assignment-4-packages-and-shiny-apps-neharika999/movie")

title: movie: A Package for Analyzing and Exploring Summer-Themed Movies — movie
text: filter_movies_by_genre() function filters movie dataset genre. ’s example:
code: # Filter for drama movies filtered_data <- summer_movies %>% filter(genres == "Drama") head(filtered_data)

title: movie: A Package for Analyzing and Exploring Summer-Themed Movies — movie
text: Use ggplot2 visualize IMDb rating trends filtered data:
code: library(ggplot2)  # Plot average ratings for Comedy movies over time ggplot(filtered_data, aes(x = year, y = average_rating)) +   geom_line(color = "blue") +   geom_point() +   labs(title = "Average Ratings of Comedy Movies Over Time",        x = "Year", y = "Average Rating")

title: movie: A Package for Analyzing and Exploring Summer-Themed Movies — movie
text: package includes interactive Shiny app. can launch :   Shiny app provides intuitive interface filter visualize movie data based genre, year, rating.
code: launch_app()

title: movie: A Package for Analyzing and Exploring Summer-Themed Movies — movie
text: dataset contains details summer-themed movies, including: tconst: Unique identifier movie. title_type: Type title (e.g., movie, short). primary_title: Main title movie. original_title: Original title movie. year: Year release. runtime_minutes: Duration movie minutes. genres: Genres associated movie. average_rating: IMDb average rating. num_votes: Number votes movie received.

title: movie: A Package for Analyzing and Exploring Summer-Themed Movies — movie
text: dataset contains genre information movie identified tconst, allowing filtering analysis genre.

text: detailed guide, load vignette:
code: vignette("movie_analysis")

title: Summer Movie Genres Dataset — summer_movie_genres
text: dataset provides genre information associated movie, using unique identifiers summer_movies. intended complement main summer_movies dataset, enabling users filter analyze data based genre.

title: Summer Movie Genres Dataset — summer_movie_genres
code: summer_movie_genres

title: Summer Movie Genres Dataset — summer_movie_genres
text: data frame following columns: tconst Character. Unique identifier movie, matching tconst field summer_movies dataset. genres Character. Genre(s) associated movie (e.g., "Action", "Romance").

title: Summer Movie Genres Dataset — summer_movie_genres
code: data(summer_movie_genres) head(summer_movie_genres) #> # A tibble: 6 × 2 #>   tconst    genres  #>   <chr>     <chr>   #> 1 tt0011462 Drama   #> 2 tt0026714 Comedy  #> 3 tt0026714 Fantasy #> 4 tt0026714 Romance #> 5 tt0033864 Comedy  #> 6 tt0037325 Crime

title: Summer Movies Dataset — summer_movies
text: dataset contains information summer-themed movies, including movie titles, release year, runtime, genres, IMDb rating, number votes. used analyze trends patterns movies commonly released summer season.

title: Summer Movies Dataset — summer_movies
code: summer_movies

title: Summer Movies Dataset — summer_movies
text: data frame following columns: tconst Character. Unique identifier movie. title_type Character. Type title (e.g., "movie", "short"). primary_title Character. Main title movie. original_title Character. Original title movie. year Integer. Year movie released. runtime_minutes Numeric. Runtime movie minutes. genres Character. Genres associated movie (e.g., "Comedy", "Drama"). average_rating Numeric. IMDb average rating movie. num_votes Integer. Number votes received IMDb.

title: Summer Movies Dataset — summer_movies
text: IMDb dataset, curated TidyTuesday.

title: Summer Movies Dataset — summer_movies
code: data(summer_movies) head(summer_movies) #> # A tibble: 6 × 10 #>   tconst    title_type primary_title original_title  year runtime_minutes genres #>   <chr>     <chr>      <chr>         <chr>          <dbl>           <dbl> <chr>  #> 1 tt0011462 movie      Midsummer Ma… Midsummer Mad…  1920              60 Drama  #> 2 tt0026714 movie      A Midsummer … A Midsummer N…  1935             133 Comed… #> 3 tt0033864 movie      The Teachers… Magistrarna p…  1941              86 Comedy #> 4 tt0037325 movie      Summer Storm  Summer Storm    1944             106 Crime… #> 5 tt0038406 movie      Centennial S… Centennial Su…  1946             102 Histo… #> 6 tt0038738 tvMovie    A Midsummer … A Midsummer N…  1946             150 Drama… #> # ℹ 3 more variables: simple_title <chr>, average_rating <dbl>, num_votes <dbl>
